text: is the core concept behind hs-react-boilerplate that  `app.module` is the only react-specific module needed and then the rest of the app would pretty much be built in React? (using components?) (I'm new to React but have to start learning it ASAP)
should I think of it like a single page app?

Generally speaking yes.

With Vue.JS it’s a little different because Vue works pretty well when sprinkled around in separate modules. It just depends on the kind of stuff you’re trying to do.

I believe ReactJS has also evolved with portals etc to make it easier to work with these components separated. I would defer to someone who’s more experienced in the current version of React though to chime on that
Thanks, that helps. The ideal of portals is really interesting too. I'll look into that
